speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. The Shepherd's cottage.

text_entry: Humbling their deities to love, have taken

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: The shapes of beasts upon them: Jupiter

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Became a bull, and bellow'd; the green Neptune

text_entry: Golden Apollo, a poor humble swain,

speaker: FLORIZEL

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Nor in a way so chaste, since my desires

text_entry: Run not before mine honour, nor my lusts

speaker: FLORIZEL

text_entry: O, but, sir,

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: Your resolution cannot hold, when 'tis

speaker: PERDITA

speaker: PERDITA

text_entry: Thou dearest Perdita,

speaker: FLORIZEL

speaker: PERDITA

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: I understand the business, I hear it: to have an

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: open ear, a quick eye, and a nimble hand, is

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: necessary for a cut-purse; a good nose is requisite

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: also, to smell out work for the other senses. I see

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: this is the time that the unjust man doth thrive.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: What an exchange had this been without boot! What

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: a boot is here with this exchange! Sure the gods do

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: this year connive at us, and we may do any thing

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: extempore. The prince himself is about a piece of

speaker: AUTOLYCUS

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: do't: I hold it the more knavery to conceal it;

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: and therein am I constant to my profession.

text_entry: Aside, aside; here is more matter for a hot brain:

text_entry: See, see; what a man you are now!

text_entry: There is no other way but to tell the king

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Nay, but hear me.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Nay, but hear me.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Go to, then.

text_entry: She being none of your flesh and blood, your flesh

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and blood has not offended the king; and so your

speaker: Clown
text_entry: flesh and blood is not to be punished by him. Show

text_entry: neither to his father nor to me, to go about to make

speaker: Clown
text_entry: could have been to him and then your blood had been

text_entry: the dearer by I know how much an ounce.

text_entry: [Aside]  Very wisely, puppies!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Well, let us to the king: there is that in this

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: fardel will make him scratch his beard.

text_entry: [Aside]  I know not what impediment this complaint

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Pray heartily he be at palace.

text_entry: sometimes by chance: let me pocket up my pedlar's excrement.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Takes off his false beard

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: How now, rustics! whither are you bound?

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: To the palace, an it like your worship.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Your affairs there, what, with whom, the condition

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: of that fardel, the place of your dwelling, your

speaker: Clown
text_entry: We are but plain fellows, sir.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: A lie; you are rough and hairy. Let me have no

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: lying: it becomes none but tradesmen, and they

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: often give us soldiers the lie: but we pay them for

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: it with stamped coin, not stabbing steel; therefore

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: they do not give us the lie.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Your worship had like to have given us one, if you

speaker: Clown
text_entry: had not taken yourself with the manner.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Are you a courtier, an't like you, sir?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Whether it like me or no, I am a courtier. Seest

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: thou not the air of the court in these enfoldings?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: hath not my gait in it the measure of the court?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: receives not thy nose court-odor from me? reflect I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: not on thy baseness court-contempt? Thinkest thou,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: for that I insinuate, or toaze from thee thy

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: business, I am therefore no courtier? I am courtier

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: cap-a-pe; and one that will either push on or pluck

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: back thy business there: whereupon I command thee to

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: open thy affair.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: My business, sir, is to the king.

text_entry: What advocate hast thou to him?

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: I know not, an't like you.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: have none.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: None, sir; I have no pheasant, cock nor hen.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: How blessed are we that are not simple men!

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Yet nature might have made me as these are,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Therefore I will not disdain.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: This cannot be but a great courtier.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: His garments are rich, but he wears

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: them not handsomely.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: He seems to be the more noble in being fantastical:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a great man, I'll warrant; I know by the picking

speaker: Clown
text_entry: on's teeth.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: The fardel there? what's i' the fardel?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Wherefore that box?

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Sir, there lies such secrets in this fardel and box,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: which none must know but the king; and which he

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: shall know within this hour, if I may come to the

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: speech of him.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Age, thou hast lost thy labour.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Why, sir?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: The king is not at the palace; he is gone aboard a

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: new ship to purge melancholy and air himself: for,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: if thou beest capable of things serious, thou must

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: know the king is full of grief.

speaker: Shepard
text_entry: So 'tis said, sir; about his son, that should have

speaker: Shepard
text_entry: married a shepherd's daughter.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: If that shepherd be not in hand-fast, let him fly:

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: the curses he shall have, the tortures he shall

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: feel, will break the back of man, the heart of monster.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Think you so, sir?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Not he alone shall suffer what wit can make heavy

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: and vengeance bitter; but those that are germane to

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: him, though removed fifty times, shall all come

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: under the hangman: which though it be great pity,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: yet it is necessary. An old sheep-whistling rogue a

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: ram-tender, to offer to have his daughter come into

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: grace! Some say he shall be stoned; but that death

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: is too soft for him, say I draw our throne into a

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: sheep-cote! all deaths are too few, the sharpest too easy.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Has the old man e'er a son, sir, do you hear. an't

speaker: Clown
text_entry: like you, sir?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: He has a son, who shall be flayed alive; then

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: 'nointed over with honey, set on the head of a

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: wasp's nest; then stand till he be three quarters

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: and a dram dead; then recovered again with

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: aqua-vitae or some other hot infusion; then, raw as

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: he is, and in the hottest day prognostication

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: proclaims, shall be be set against a brick-wall, the

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: sun looking with a southward eye upon him, where he

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: is to behold him with flies blown to death. But what

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: talk we of these traitorly rascals, whose miseries

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: are to be smiled at, their offences being so

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: capital? Tell me, for you seem to be honest plain

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: men, what you have to the king: being something

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: gently considered, I'll bring you where he is

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: aboard, tender your persons to his presence,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: whisper him in your behalfs; and if it be in man

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: besides the king to effect your suits, here is man

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: shall do it.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: He seems to be of great authority: close with him,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: give him gold; and though authority be a stubborn

speaker: Clown
text_entry: bear, yet he is oft led by the nose with gold: show

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the inside of your purse to the outside of his hand,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and no more ado. Remember 'stoned,' and 'flayed alive.'

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: An't please you, sir, to undertake the business for

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: us, here is that gold I have: I'll make it as much

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: more and leave this young man in pawn till I bring it you.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: After I have done what I promised?

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Ay, sir.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Well, give me the moiety. Are you a party in this business?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: In some sort, sir: but though my case be a pitiful

speaker: Clown
text_entry: one, I hope I shall not be flayed out of it.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: O, that's the case of the shepherd's son: hang him,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: he'll be made an example.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Comfort, good comfort! We must to the king and show

speaker: Clown
text_entry: our strange sights: he must know 'tis none of your

speaker: Clown
text_entry: daughter nor my sister; we are gone else. Sir, I

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will give you as much as this old man does when the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: business is performed, and remain, as he says, your

speaker: Clown
text_entry: pawn till it be brought you.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: I will trust you. Walk before toward the sea-side;

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: go on the right hand: I will but look upon the

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: hedge and follow you.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: We are blest in this man, as I may say, even blest.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Let's before as he bids us: he was provided to do us good.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Exeunt Shepherd and Clown

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: If I had a mind to be honest, I see Fortune would

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: not suffer me: she drops booties in my mouth. I am

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: courted now with a double occasion, gold and a means

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: to do the prince my master good; which who knows how

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: that may turn back to my advancement? I will bring

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: these two moles, these blind ones, aboard him: if he

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: think it fit to shore them again and that the

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: complaint they have to the king concerns him

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: nothing, let him call me rogue for being so far

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: officious; for I am proof against that title and

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: what shame else belongs to't. To him will I present

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: them: there may be matter in it.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
